newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares end lower on late selling.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares end lower on late selling.

text.p: Late selling by profit takers and domestic institutions drove Delhi stocks lower at close on Wednesday.
At the end of trading, the Delhi Stock Exchange benchmark index was 7.9 points lower at 857.95.
"Today's session was of a purely speculative nature. Highly active stocks were bought and sold mainly by speculators," Harish Malhotra of brokerage Malhotra Financial Services said.
Traders said foreign institutions had extended their buying activity until mid-session, and had diluted their positions in late trading. This reversed early rising trends, they said.
The market commenced on a firm note after the petroleum minister was quoted by a newspaper as saying any hike in petroleum prices would be negligible.
After reaching a high of 327.10 rupees, Reliance Industries fell to 320.05.
State Bank of India fell 4.50 rupees to 325.50, after rising earlier to 335.45.
ITC Ltd was one of heaviest traded stocks, and lost 7.35 rupees to 495.75.
ACC fell 69.15 rupees to 1169.85, induced by expectations of poor working results, brokers said. The company was due to announce its results later on Wednesday.
Larsen and Toubro fell 6.05 rupees to 235.70.
TELCO edged up one rupee to 440.0
